alert.note: Alert for Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 03 at 3:04PM CDT until April 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Today For Portions of East Colorado as the Fire Weather Watch has been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning. A Dangerous Fire Weather Day Will Unfold On Tuesday For Portions of Northwest Kansas... .Critical fire weather conditions are again expected across Kit Carson and Cheyenne counties in Colorado today as a Red Flag Warning has been issued. Dangerous fire weather potential is increasing for portions of northwest Kansas on Tuesday. Gusty to strong southwest winds will eventually become northwesterly as a cold front moves through the area; gusty to strong winds are also expected behind the wind shift. Blowing dust is also possible due to multiple days of warm and breezy conditions across the area. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 027... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 7 PM MDT Tuesday. * Affected Area...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace. * Winds...South-Southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph, shifting to the Northwest in the afternoon. * Relative Humidity...As low as 13 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
